targets.expr:
scrape_samples_scraped{job!="prometheus"} * 1
   unless (mysql_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (my_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (oracledb_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (pg_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (mssql_batch_requests{alias!~"$alias"} >= 1)

up{job!="prometheus"}
   unless (mysql_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (my_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (oracledb_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (pg_up{alias!~"$alias"} == 1)
   unless (mssql_batch_requests{alias!~"$alias"} >= 1)

panels.description: - The time taken for Prometheus to scrape metrics from a target. It helps identify performance issues or delays in data collection.
panels.title: Scrape_time

panels.description: - The total number of samples successfully scraped from a target. It helps monitor the volume of data collected during each scrape.
panels.title: Scrape_count

panels.description:
- The total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.
- = Active session
panels.title: $alias

panels.description:
- The total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.
- = Active session
panels.title: SQL Time

panels.description: The Number of executions per second of statements.
panels.title: SQL Exec.

panels.description:
The number of rows read during statements' execution.
= rows_examined
panels.title: SQL rows read

panels.description: - The number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time.
panels.title: Slow queries

panels.description: The time spent waiting for locks.
panels.title: Lock Wait Time

panels.description: - The number of logical read requests
panels.title: Logical reads

panels.description: - The number of requests to read directly from disk. innodb_buffer_pool_reads
panels.title: Disk reads

panels.description:
- read rows = read_rnd_next + read_next + read_prev
- read_rnd_next: The number of requests to read the next row in the data file. This value is high if you are doing a lot of table scans.
- read_next : The number of requests to read the next row in key order. This value is incremented if you are querying an index column with a range constraint or if you are doing an index scan.
- read_prev: The number of requests to read the previous row in key order. This read method is mainly used to optimize ORDER BY ... DESC.
panels.title: Handler - read rows

panels.description: - The number of threads that are not sleeping
panels.title: Threads running

panels.description: - The number of currently open connections
panels.title: Current Conn.

panels.description: - The number of bytes received from all clients.
panels.title: N/W - In

list.label: Group
